commenter_b: No, the representation in the Senate is not of the people, but of the states. Each state has two Senators. That's equal representation. If you want representation of the people, you're looking in the wrong chamber.
commenter_a: It is a very good thing that urban power centres cannot set the taxes of their rural neighbours. If they could the rural producers would become slaves and would have no quality of life in the pursuit of urban consumers actively destroying rural methods of negotiation. This is NOT a failing of the system, it is exactly why the system is in place. It is a good thing that farmers are not economic slaves of nearby cities.
